nodes.bodyText:
@scholzj let me don't agree on that :-) For each row you have the resource name, the kind and description so something like:
| resource name | kind | description |
_cluster-name_-zookeeper-nodes  Service  used to have DNS resolve the ZooKeeper pods IP addresses
_cluster-name_-zookeeper-nodes  Secret    contains ZooKeeper node keys
You can think about the current state as a table missing the column separation ... see this (using |||| to separate)
_cluster-name_-zookeeper-nodes |||| Service |||| needed to have DNS resolve the ZooKeeper pods IP addresses directly.
_cluster-name_-zookeeper-nodes|||| Secret |||| with ZooKeeper node keys.
It's just that the kind is lost in the description. The table is much more readable (even if I am not great to format it in the example above)
